poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network (MIP63c4-SP2) - March 14, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP63c4-SP2: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network

content.content: MIP63c4-SP2: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network  Preamble MIP63c4-SP#: 2 Title: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network Author(s): Sam MacPherson (@hexonaut) Contributors: Tags: keeper-network Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-01-20 Date Ratified: 2022-03-28 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmaEfChz?network=mainnet#poll-detail Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip63c4-sp2-onboard-amend-keeper-network-keep3r-network/12748   Specification   Name: Keep3r Network  Short Name: KEEP3R  Website: https://keep3r.network/   Requested Budget: 0 DAI / day  Requested Buffer Min: N/A  Requested Buffer Max: N/A  Chain: All  Address to Stream DAI to: N/A   Network Description This is an onboarding application for Keep3r Network. A decentralized, permissionless keeper network.  They are currently maintaining operations pro-bono during this initial testing phase, but will need a budget eventually.  Expected Coverage  ALL
content.GPT-summary: The post is an onboarding application for Keep3r Network, a decentralized, permissionless keeper network. The author explains the proposal and provides details such as the requested budget and expected coverage. There is no negative feedback or criticism provided, but a 3rd party extends to the proposal and provides entirely positive feedback. The post can also be seen as advertising the Keep3r Network proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Hey @hexonaut Great to see the fast progress of the third-party Keeper Network with this and Gelato. Specifically to this MIP, I’m curious why choose Keep3r Network? It’s nice that they’re doing pro-bono work, but I haven’t seen their performance outside of Andre’s own projects. On that note, Andre’s recent close partnerships with Daniele Sestagalli have me concerned because the Abracadabra community has been hostile towards MakerDAO. I’m not a fan of them actively cheering for our downfall and saying they’ll replace us through things like byebyedai.money. I’m honestly not sure where his fleeting loyalty lies, along with his supporters.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Keep3r Network has proven to be a reliable backbone of the DeFi ecosystem. They provide services to Yearn and Mushrooms Finance. The nice thing about MIP63 is that this is built for redundancy. If one network misbehaves then the other networks will take over to fill their duties. If they do not resolve their issues we can give them the boot. Basically this means that a single misbehaving network does not threaten the security of the keeper network so long as we resolve things in a reasonable time frame. So really we should be adding any service as long as they are not complete scams or something.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Thanks that makes sense! I agree that more is better, especially on active days like today. In this case, have you or the PECU taken a look at Chainlink’s Keepers? I learned about it by trying options on Premia, which did a good job automatically exercising my expired OTM options. I quickly reviewed the Keeper docs, and it looks like it’s permissionless to register, which, if I’m not mistaken, would fit nicely into our new MIP63 architecture as you described. The pricing is also in the docs to help determine the funding needed for a backup Keeper. There’s also OpenZeppelin Defender, which I don’t know much about, but they advertise it as “free*”. I’m sure there’s some upcharge plan, but it still might work for us as a backup. I’d say both of those are reputable companies and not scams. I could submit these as MIP-63c4-SP4 and MIP-63c4-SP5, respectively, but I’d like to have the PECU’s expertise and input first
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Absolutely we should add these networks. Just because Gelato and Keep3r are first doesn’t mean they should be the only ones. Before submitting MIP63c4 proposals they should first build a proof of concept and prove that they can run keepers according to the spec before we start shipping DAI to them. If you want to take the lead on this feel free to do so. I’ll be available for any technical chats. @hexonaut on TG. They should use the dss-cron repository to get the latest info as it has deviated slightly from the MIP based on iterative rounds with Gelato and Keep3r.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Hello everyone, PEPO from DeFi Wonderland, we are leading the development of Keep3r Network and we are currently the integrators of Keep3r on MakerDAO’s Keeper Network We made a small public dashboard for tracking the performance of Keep3r within Maker’s Jobs    dune.xyz    Dune Analytics Ethereum Ecosystem analytics by and for the community. Explore and share data from Ethereum Mainnet, Matic, Optimism and xDai for free.

content.content: Awesome work guys! Very helpful to get insights into how things are running.
